subtitle: hi this is Simon Jacobsen welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question for this
week is about a midlife crisis is
midlife crisis a real concept if so how
can we overcome it how can we prevent it
from developing in the next generation
life is a journey and each of us has
been sent here on a mission and when you
understand that every moment of your day
and every experience that you will
undergo in your life is part of your
journey then there really should be no
crisis think of a swimmer navigating the
waves waves change throughout life
sometimes the seas are calm sometimes
they're more turbulent the challenge is
how to create balance that were no
matter what you go through in life you
find how to fulfill your purpose in that
particular area of your life we begin as
children and clearly we have a certain
role to play then we grow into teenagers
we marry and build families we become
parents and later grandparents in each
of the stages of life were just simply
another leg of that journey and that's
the leg that you need to focus on the
mere concept of saying a middle-age
crisis is suggesting that you lived your
life and now what are you going to do
next every aspect of life even old age
even when you may be weaker it's still
fulfilling your divine purpose your
mission when a soul recognizes its
purpose in life it also does not age it
knows how to navigate and find the
proper approach the proper tools and
skills in every given area where there
shouldn't be a mid age crisis or for
that matter a young age or old age
crisis at all this has been meaningful
Monday's where we address your questions
if you'd like to submit a question

like and share
everyone have a very meaningful week
